text: The Messenger of Allah (صلى الله عليه وسلم) said: Whoever forgets a prayer, let him pray it when he remembers it.
The Prophet said, "All drinks that produce intoxication are Haram (forbidden to drink).
Whenever the Prophet got up at night, he used to clean his mouth with Siwak.
Allah's Apostle said, "If anyone of you enters a mosque, he should pray two Rakat before sitting."
Allah's Apostle said, "Whenever you hear the Adhan, say what the Muadhin is saying.
The Prophet said, "If supper is served, and Iqama is pronounced one should start with the supper."
The Prophet used to pray a short prayer (in congregation) but used to offer it in a perfect manner.
The Prophet said, "Straighten your rows or Allah will alter your faces."
Allah's Apostle said, "Whoever does not recite Al-Fatiha in his prayer, his prayer is invalid."
Allah's Apostle (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone of you attending the Friday (prayers) should take a bath."
Whenever Allah's Apostle saw the rain, he used to say, "O Allah! Let it be a strong fruitful rain."
Whenever the Prophet got up for Tahajjud prayer he used to clean his mouth (and teeth) with Siwak.
The Prophet used to lie down on his right side, after offering two Rakat (Sunna) of the Fajr prayer.
Allah's Apostle said, "Offer some of your prayers in your houses and do not make them graves."
Allah's Apostle said, "Between my house and the pulpit there is a garden of the gardens of Paradise."
The Prophet said, "The real patience is at the first stroke of a calamity."
The Prophet ordered the people to pay Zakat-ul-Fitr before going to the Eid prayer.
The Prophet said, "O Allah! Bestow on Medina twice the blessings You bestowed on Makkah."
Allah's Apostle said, "When Ramadan begins, the gates of Paradise are opened."
Allah's Apostle used to practise Itikaf in the last ten days of the month of Ramadan.
The Prophet (SAW) said, "Az-Zulm (Oppression) will be a darkness on the Day of Resurrection."
Allah's Messenger used to accept gifts and used to give something in return.
The Prophet (SAW) said, "He who takes back his present is like him who swallows his vomit."
The Prophet (SAW) said, "Plague is the cause of martyrdom of every Muslim (who dies because of it)."
The Prophet said, "None of you will have faith till he wishes for his (Muslim) brother what he likes for himself."
The Prophet said "None of you will have faith till he loves me more than his father, his children and all mankind."
Allah's Apostle said, 'Whoever prays the two cool prayers ('Asr and Fajr) will go to Paradise.'
The Prophet said, "The prayer in congregation is twenty-five times superior to the prayer offered by person alone."
The Prophet (saw) said to Abu-Dhar, "Listen and obey (your chief) even if he is an Ethiopian with a head like a raisin."
Allah's Apostle said, "You will be rewarded for whatever you spend for Allah's sake even if it were a morsel which you put in your wife's mouth."
The Prophet said, "If anyone of you feels drowsy while praying, he should sleep till he understands what he is saying (reciting)."
The Prophet said, "Straighten your rows as the straightening of rows is essential for a perfect and correct prayer."
Allah's Apostle said, "One prayer in my Mosque is better than one thousand prayers in any other mosque except Al-Masjid-AI-Haram."
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "The best charity is that which is practiced by a wealthy person. And start giving first to your dependents."
The Prophet said to me, "Do not withhold your money, (for if you did so) Allah would with-hold His blessings from you."
Allah's Apostle said, "There are angels guarding the entrances (or roads) of Medina, neither plague nor Ad-Dajjal will be able to enter it."
Allah's Apostle said, "The people will remain on the right path as long as they hasten the breaking of the fast."
The Prophet said, "A time will come when one will not care how one gains one's money, legally or illegally."
Allah's Apostle said, "May Allah's mercy be on him who is lenient in his buying, selling, and in demanding back his money."
The Apostle of Allah (may peace be upon him) used to remember Allah at all moments.
Bilal was commanded (by the Holy Prophet) to repeat the phrases twice in Adhan, and once in lqama.
The Prophet (pbuh) said: Iman has over seventy branches, and modesty is a branch of Iman.
The Apostle (pbuh) observed: When a man calls his brother an unbeliever, it returns (at least) to one of them.
The Apostle of Allah observed: The best of' the deeds or deed is the (observance of) prayer at its proper time and kindness to the parents.
The Apostle of Allah (pbuh) observed: He who as in his heart the weight of a mustard seed of pride shall not enter Paradise.
The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: The Hour (Resurrection) would not come upon anyone so long as he supplicates Allah.
The Messenger of Allah (pbuh) loved to start from the right-hand side for performing ablution, for combing (the hair) and wearing the shoes.
The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: When the Muadhin calls to prayer, Satan runs back vehemently.
The earth has been made for me purifying and as a mosque (place for prayer).
The supplication made between the adhan and the iqamah is not rejected.
Let the best among you call the adhan for you, and the Quran-readers act as your imams.
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said: The best of you are those whose shoulders are soft in prayer.
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said: Have the imam in the centre and close up the gaps.
Your mouths are the paths of the Quran, so perfume them with the tooth stick
The Messenger of Allah (saw) used to remember Allah in all circumstances.
The Messenger of Allah (saw) used to make his prayer brief but perfect.
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Beautify the Quran with your voices."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'Patience should come with the first shock."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Eat Suhur, for in Suhur there is a blessing."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) forbade fasting on the Day of Fitr and the Day of Adha.
The Prophet (saw) said: "A grateful eater is equal to a patient fasting person."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "The best of you are those who are best to their womenfolk."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "The most hated of permissible things to Allah is divorce."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'Do not take oaths by idols nor by your forefathers."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "An oath (leads to) either sin or regret."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Your oath is as your companion understands it to be."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Whoever achieves at something, let him stick with It."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "No one hoards but a sinner."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "When you weigh, allow more."
The Prophet (saw) said: "O Allah, bless my nation in their early mornings."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Do not take back your charity."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: "Give the worker his wages before his sweat dries."
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: 'Do Wudu properly.'
The Messenger of Allah (saw) said: Whoever is in the Masjid waiting for the prayer, he is in a state of prayer.
The Prophet (saw) said: One of the portents of the Hour will be that people will show off in building Masjids.
